caption: La Galerie Vivienne offers a unique experience à la Française, transporting you back to the elegance of the 1820s. Stroll through this iconic passage where history meets charm, discover hidden treasures in its quaint bookshops, admire art in its galleries, or select a fine bottle of wine. Between the inviting cafés and restaurants, it’s the perfect place to meet friends for dinner and savor a timeless Parisian moment.

One of the oldest passages and stores in Paris. You can smell the history in this place. You'll find a lot of stores here, and a very special library. It is a place you cannot miss when visiting Paris.
A great find very tasty original menu great service. Reasonable prices. Very nicely decorated.

While you could describe Galerie Vivienne as a mall, the term would falsely evoke for Americans those structures which housed the Nordstroms, Sees and Barnes & Nobles of our bygone childhoods.  On the other hand a 200 year old covered passageway like Galerie Vivienne adorned with ornate iron roof and decor is something different.  It is an opportunity to stroll through shops, while imagining what old Paris was like when wealthy ladies would stroll through the passageways with their enormous bustled dresses, and they had husbands or lady servants who carry their parcels for them .
Every thing about Paris is oh la la. Le Grand Colbert has fantastic food, just be prepared to wait for a table even if you have a reservation. Creme brûlée is amazing!

A must see in Paris though it gets really crowded on weekends. It embodies the French conception of traditional mall. Lots of interesting shops along the way. Expect high markups so it’s more for window shopping. Note some interesting book stores, designers and a provocative art gallery.
A beautiful place with shops where you can buy things like clothes, souvenirs, pastries, etc. It's like a small mall. I love the dome and the corridor.
I didn't have the opportunity to enter Galerie Vivienne, but it seems to be very beautiful. At the front, there are fancy and expensive restaurants where people seemed to be having a good time.

There several « passages «  in Paris or covered galleries that have been preserved very well and Galerie Vivienne is one of them. It’s not only beautiful and charming, it also hosts a cohort of little shops, some stylish ones, an amazing bookstore with antique books in various languages, a great cafe to eat a lovely lunch or just great sorbet.
A very beautiful alley with a lot of stores to shop from.

This historic covered passage and shopping arcade is a must visit while you are in Paris. Located in the second arrondissement, this passage has beautiful mosaic floor and covered with glass ceilings.  Visiting this galerie can especially be a great alternative if you have to spend a rainy (or hot) day in Paris. There are plenty of options inside, including a variety of restaurants offering gourmet food and cafes. The passage is also adorned with interesting decorative designs and sculptures. It’s considered as one of the most glamorous covered passages in Paris, a Pompeian style masterpiece!  Besides the art galleries, fashion boutiques, and wine tasting, should make special mention of the bookstore it houses – Jousseame, originally called Librariere Petit-Siroux, one of the original tenants of this passage.  You should plan on spending at least a few hours in this passage, if not longer to take in the history, architecture, and everything else it has to offer, besides perhaps relaxing at a restaurant or café.
A beautiful, historic passage. There are a so many cool and cute little shops. It is one of the best places to shop for souvenirs, I definitely recommend visiting while in Paris!

🇫🇷Galerie Vivienne in France is a captivating destination that transports you to a bygone era of elegance and sophistication. As you wander through its enchanting passages, you're surrounded by a curated selection of boutique shops, charming cafes, and artisanal galleries. The architecture is simply breathtaking, with ornate details and glass ceilings that fill the space with natural light. It's a haven for lovers of art, culture, and history, offering a unique blend of old-world charm and modern-day allure. Whether you're browsing for treasures, enjoying a leisurely stroll, or savoring a cup of coffee amidst the picturesque surroundings, Galerie Vivienne is a must-visit gem in the heart of France.
so beautiful! the shops and cafés are wonderful!!!

Daroco was a great venue for our daughter's special birthday celebration. With a beautiful upstairs and a mirrored ceiling this restaurant was a great find. The pizza dough was incredibly light and cooked to perfection and the staff were polite and friendly. It was full, so make sure you book in advance. A great location, venue and vibe.

Hidden gem, the history preserved well, parts of the original floor remains.  Standing in the middle of the passage, you can only imagine what it would have looked like back in 1825.  Too bad not all Parisiens could enjoy its beauty and comfort.

Nice cozy place in a gallery. Staff was really great and caring (especially the Italian waiter). We got some coffees and tea gourmand. All good.  Little bad note: they only accept credit card from 10€. Which is a red flag to me, considering how cheap are the fees and being in the center of one of the most touristic places in the world. Just let us pay with our cards.
Beautiful passage with lovely shops. Highly recommend checking it out if in Paris.
Located in the second Arr, the is a rather pretty passage way, plenty architecture to admire, whilst walking through, we especially love that it is dog friendly.

Lovely lights in this beautiful galerie! Lots of shops, cafés, boutiques in an enchanting atmosphere.  Very easy to get to, and there is a beautiful library right next to this walk.  Definitely recommend a walk through, and during Christmas, it's even more enchanting.
Beautiful,nice shoppes , less crowded and great place to take a few pictures .
magic atmosphere, especially with christmas lights
Might be interesting from a historical point of view but there isn't much of unique architecture or considerable work of art noticeable.

On 5 Rue de la Banque, 75002, lies one of the most elegant covered passages in Paris. The covered passages and galleries of Paris are home to antique store, tearooms restaurants, coffee shops, bookstores with old books, theatres and even small museums and boutique hotels entrances. Most were built in the 19th century. These galleries are often difficult to find, because piercing the middle of the buildings, not being specially signaled, they can go unnoticed. So, make your searches before the stroll, or choose to join a guided tour that offers passages. Surmounted by glass roofs to be enlightened, they have become a typical Parisian curiosity and tourist attraction. Don't miss them if you're in Paris❗ There are about twenty of them, located around the Haussmannian "Grand Boulevards", but you don't have to see them all. Visit a couple of them, which are the most interesting, should be enough. Start with the famous *Galerie Vivienne (just behind the Palais-Royal former Palais Cardinal), then the nearby *Colbert gallery with no shops, but a good and elegant brasserie, 'Grand Colbert'. Gallery Colbert is known for its colonnade and its Art Deco style. Then continue with: *Panorama passage with its theater "des Variétés" (dates from the dawn of the 19th century, 1799), *Brady Passage (also called "Little India") known for Indian and Pakistani restaurants, then *Jouffroy Passage (a quite unique passage, with its Grévin wax figures Museum, the Hotel Chopin and not to be missed Valentin teahouse. Other passages worth a stroll are: *Verdeau (known for its antique shops), *Cairo (known for garments and fabrics) and *Passage du Grand-Cerf. Enjoy the stroll in your own or on a guided tour❗
One of the oldest galleries in Paris with different shops and cafes
Loved this spot. It has numerous amazing places nearby as well and lots of Korean/Japanese and Italian food options as well. The passage itself is beautiful and a must visit.

These galleries are often difficult to find, because piercing the middle of the buildings, not being specially signaled, they can go unnoticed. Hidden gems of Paris.  There are several in the city and each one is unique in their own beauty.  This one is located on 5 Rue de la Banque.  Inside the passage you will find are antique stores,tearooms restaurants, coffee shops, bookstores with old books and papers.
So cute and gorgeous little hidden passage, with all glasses for the roof ceiling !! I’ve been to Paris sooo many times but didn’t know about this ! So stoked for having found it!

One of I believe 5 (could be wrong on exact number) covered passages that offer plenty of shops, and eating choices. Thought they would be decorated more for the Christmas season so was slightly disappointed about that. But very interesting to see and learn the history behind them.
Beautiful architecture but most shops closed
Wonderful architecture with good restaurants and charming stores
Very small area for walking, nothing seemed interesting! This vintage book shop the only thing caught my eyes.
Cute place, very classic French, nothing too exceptional, but a good option if you are in the area.

Gorgeous at Night: Twinkling Lights; Cozy Eateries; Delightful Wine Bar!  Lovely at Day: Fabulous Boutiques; Charming Bookstore! Amazing Both Night and Day: Beautiful Architecture; Intriguing Mosaic Floorings!
Very cute shopping gallery in paris. Has some small local brands for woman's fashion and cosy bistro's. Gets pretty hot in the summer there so be prepared.
We air BNB here. The Gallery has everything. Good place to shop and eat
We came at a time when many of the shops were closed/on vacation only a few restaurants open, the passageway itself is very beautiful
Beautiful covered collection of shops and restaurants. Mosaics and glass.
